meanings.definition: To equip (a tool) with a ferrule.
meanings.sent1: He ferrelled the hammer to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter ferrelled the screwdriver for better grip.
meanings.sent3: The handyman ferrelled the wrench, giving it a shiny new look.
meanings.sent4: She ferrelled the paintbrush, adding a touch of elegance to her tools.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith ferrelled the chisel, ensuring its durability for years to come.

meanings.definition: To secure (a tool) in a handle with a ferrule.
meanings.sent1: He ferrelled the knife handle to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman ferrelled the chisel securely in place.
meanings.sent3: The chef ferrelled the spatula, making sure it wouldn't slip.
meanings.sent4: She ferrelled the rake handle, ensuring a firm grip.
meanings.sent5: The gardener ferrelled the shovel, ready for heavy-duty work.

meanings.definition: To repair or renew the end of (a tool) by putting on a ferrule.
meanings.sent1: He ferrelled the broomstick to extend its life.
meanings.sent2: The handyman ferrelled the mop handle to fix the loose end.
meanings.sent3: She ferrelled the paint roller, giving it a fresh start.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter ferrelled the rake, making it as good as new.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic ferrelled the screwdriver, ready for more projects.
